comment: Would love to see the cars people drove during their high school years. Here's my high school rides. Ranchero and Studebaker
amr:
# ::snt Would love to see the cars people drove during their high school years. Here's my high school rides. Ranchero and Studebaker
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (l / love-02
            :ARG0 (ii / i)
            :ARG1 (s / see-01
                  :ARG0 ii
                  :ARG1 (c / car
                        :ARG1-of (d / drive-01
                              :ARG0 (p / person)
                              :time (y / year
                                    :mod (h / high-school)
                                    :poss p)))))
      :snt2 (r / ride-01
            :ARG0 (ii2 / i)
            :mod (h2 / high-school)
            :location (h3 / here))
      :snt3 (a / and
            :op1 (c2 / car
                  :name (n / name
                        :op1 "Ranchero"))
            :op2 (c3 / car
                  :name (n2 / name
                        :op1 " Studebaker"))))

# ::snt wait, are you a boomer?
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (w / wait-01
            :mode imperative
            :ARG1 (y / you))
      :snt2 (b / boomer
            :domain y
            :polarity (a / amr-unknown)))

comment: Use a more concrete reference that could help tremendously to convey a more meaningful point than one that may potentially be misconstrued.
amr:
# ::snt Use a more concrete reference that could help tremendously to convey a more meaningful point than one that may potentially be misconstrued.
(u / use-01
      :mode imperative
      :ARG0 (y / you)
      :ARG1 (r / reference-04
            :ARG0 y
            :ARG1-of (c / concrete-02
                  :ARG2-of (h / have-degree-91
                        :ARG1 r
                        :ARG3 (m / more)))
            :ARG0-of (h2 / help-01
                  :ARG1 (c2 / convey-01
                        :ARG0 y
                        :ARG1 (p / point-04
                              :ARG0-of (m2 / meaningful-05
                                    :ARG2-of (h3 / have-degree-91
                                          :ARG1 p
                                          :ARG3 (m3 / more)
                                          :ARG4 (o / one
                                                :ARG1-of (m4 / misconstrue-01
                                                      :ARG1-of (p2 / possible-01)))))))
                  :degree (t / tremendous))
            :ARG1-of (p3 / possible-01)))

comment: I am proud of my generation.  I feel like we have many great qualities, and have contributed a lot.
amr:

(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (p / pride-01
            :ARG0 (ii / i)
            :ARG1 (g / generation
                  :poss ii))
      :snt2 (f / feel-02
            :ARG0 (ii2 / i)
            :ARG1 (a / and
                  :op1 (h / have-03
                        :ARG0 (w / we)
                        :ARG1 (q / quality
                              :mod (g2 / great)
                              :quant (m2 / many)))
                  :op2 (c / contribute-01
                        :ARG0 w
                        :ARG1 (l / lot)))))

comment: Using the "c---" term pejoratively is offensive and should be avoided.
amr:
# ::snt Using the "c---" term pejoratively is offensive and should be avoided.
(a / and
      :op1 (o / offend-01
            :ARG0 (u / use-01
                  :ARG1 (t / term
                        :mod (s / string-entity
                              :value "c---"))
                  :manner (p / pejorative)))
      :op2 (r / recommend-01
            :ARG1 (a2 / avoid-01
                  :ARG1 u)))
